subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... There s a lot more to learn when moving to .NET than this obscure bit of trivia. I find arguments based on how other languages do things to be at best
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> ...because as soon as they try to do the same thing on another xUnit
> platform, notably NUnit, they will find only [SetUp] and [TearDown] do
> what they expected.

There's a lot more to learn when moving to .NET than this obscure bit of
trivia. I find arguments based on how other languages do things to be at
best pointless and at worst DOM. Given me the best Java API and
techniques possible, and let the .NET folks have the best .NET API and
techniques they can have. There isn't enough call for cross-language
coding and coders designing for different environments worth the huge
cost in clarity.

> Incidentally, assuming you need to tear down fixture objects -- and
> admittedly it's rare for me -- if you don't use tearDown(), then how do
> you do it? (Or is it the case for you as for me that it just doesn't
> come up much?)

It just doesn't come up that much.

--
Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
